title: Brussels Sprouts and Sausage Soup
summary: Brussels Sprouts and Sausage Soup is a gluten free, dairy free, and whole 30 recipe with 4 servings. This main course has 401 calories, 23g of protein, and 19g of fat per serving. For $2.51 per serving, this recipe covers 28% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Only a few people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. If you have andouille sausage, chicken broth, caraway seeds, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. It is perfect for Autumn. With a spoonacular score of 72%, this dish is solid. Try Brussels Sprouts with Chinese Sausage, Easy Ravioli with Sausage and Brussels Sprouts, and Savory Brussels Sprouts With Smoked Sausage for similar recipes.
instructions: Trim ends off brussels sprouts, remove any damaged external leaves, and cut in half lengthwise. Set aside.                                                                                                 Remove casing from sausage and cut into 1/4-in.-thick slices. Put olive oil and sausage in a medium pot over medium-high heat and cook, stirring occasionally, until sausage is well browned, about 7 minutes.                                                                                                 Meanwhile, peel potatoes and cut into roughly 1/2-in. pieces.                                                                                                 When sausage is browned, add bay leaves and caraway seeds to the pot. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add potatoes, broth, and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil. Add brussels sprouts. Partially cover pot and reduce heat to low or medium-low to maintain a steady simmer. Cook soup until potatoes and brussels sprouts are tender, about 15 minutes. Remove bay leaves and serve soup hot.                                                                                                Note: Nutritional analysis is per serving.

steps.step: Trim ends off brussels sprouts, remove any damaged external leaves, and cut in half lengthwise. Set aside.

Remove casing from sausage and cut into 1/4-in.-thick slices. Put olive oil and sausage in a medium pot over medium-high heat and cook, stirring occasionally, until sausage is well browned, about 7 minutes.
Meanwhile, peel potatoes and cut into roughly 1/2-in. pieces.
When sausage is browned, add bay leaves and caraway seeds to the pot. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add potatoes, broth, and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil.
Add brussels sprouts. Partially cover pot and reduce heat to low or medium-low to maintain a steady simmer. Cook soup until potatoes and brussels sprouts are tender, about 15 minutes.
Remove bay leaves and serve soup hot.
